Class Redis

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.reactivex.redis.client.Redis
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Redis
extends Object
implements ReadStream<Response>
    A simple Redis client.

        public Pipe<Response> pipe()
        Pause this stream and return a to transfer the elements of this stream to a destination .

        The stream will be resumed when the pipe will be wired to a WriteStream.

      • pipeTo

        public void pipeTo(WriteStream<Response> dst,
                   Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> handler)
        Pipe this ReadStream to the WriteStream.

        Elements emitted by this stream will be written to the write stream until this stream ends or fails.

        Once this stream has ended or failed, the write stream will be ended and the handler will be called with the result.

        Specified by:
        pipeTo in interface ReadStream<Response>
        Parameters:
        dst - the destination write stream
        handler -

        Pipe this ReadStream to the WriteStream.

        Elements emitted by this stream will be written to the write stream until this stream ends or fails.

        Once this stream has ended or failed, the write stream will be ended and the handler will be called with the result.

      • createClient

        public static Redis createClient(Vertx vertx,
                                 SocketAddress address)
        Connect to redis, the onConnect will get the Redis instance. This connection will use the default options which are connect to a standalone server on the default port on "localhost".
        Parameters:
        vertx -
        address -

      • pause

        public Redis pause()
        Pause the ReadStream, it sets the buffer in fetch mode and clears the actual demand.

        While it's paused, no data will be sent to the data handler.

        Specified by:
        pause in interface ReadStream<Response>
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

      • resume

        public Redis resume()
        Resume reading, and sets the buffer in flowing mode.

        If the ReadStream has been paused, reading will recommence on it.

        Specified by:
        resume in interface ReadStream<Response>
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

      • fetch

        public Redis fetch(long amount)
        Fetch the specified amount of elements. If the ReadStream has been paused, reading will recommence with the specified amount of items, otherwise the specified amount will be added to the current stream demand.
        Specified by:
        fetch in interface ReadStream<Response>
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

      • endHandler

        public Redis endHandler(Handler<Void> endHandler)
        Set an end handler. Once the stream has ended, and there is no more data to be read, this handler will be called.
        Specified by:
